Companion Scanner Configuration
Scanner Management

Detailed Description

Configuration functions of the Companion scanner.

Enumeration Type Documentation

- (enum) eICBarCode_IlluminationMode

An enumeration of available illuminiation modes.

Enumerator
aimerAndIlluminiationLeds 

Enable both the aimer and the leds

aimerOnly 

Enable only the aimer

illuminationLedsOnly 

enable only the leds

noIllumination 

Disable illumination

- (enum) eICBarCode_ImagerMode

An enumeration of the predefined imager mode.

These constants are to be used within configureImagerMode: method

Enumerator
ICBarCodeImagerMode_1D 

1D

ICBarCodeImagerMode_1D2D 

1D and 2D standard

ICBarCodeImagerMode_1D2D_bright 

1D and 2D bright environment

ICBarCodeImagerMode_1D2D_reflective 

1D and 2D reflective surface

- (enum) eICBarCode_LightingMode

An enumeration of the scanner's lighting modes.

Enumerator
illuminiationLEDPriority 

Shorter exposure time

aperturePriority 

Use aperture priority if you have a shiny barcode label

- (enum) eICBarCode_ScanMode

An enumeration of the scan Modes.

These constants are to be used within configureBarCodeReaderMode: function

Enumerator
ICBarCodeScanMode_SingleScan 

Single-Scan Mode

ICBarCodeScanMode_MultiScan 

Multi-Scan Mode

- (enum) eICBarCodeSymbologies

An enumeration of the symbologies supported by the barcode scanner.

Those constants are used by the enableSymbology, enableSymbologies, isSymbologyEnabled and isSymbologySupported methods

Enumerator

Unknown Symbology

Function Documentation

- (BOOL) aimerFlashing

Returns the aimer flashing state.

Returns
YES if the aimar flashing is enabled, NO otherwise
- (void) bufferWriteCommands

Disable the setupwrite message, and buffer the configuration instead.

The application MUST call unbufferSetupCommands when it wishes to send the whole configuration

- (void) configureBarCodeReaderMode: (int)  mode

To switch from single scan, multi scan, or raw mode.

In singleScan mode, the delegate function will be called when a barcode is read. In multiScan mode, the scanner will decode barcodes until the trigger is released or stopScan is called.

Parameters
modeThe barcode reader mode to be activated. One of the constants of eICBarCode_ScanMode
- (void) configureImagerMode: (int)  mode

Select a predefined imager mode.

Predefined modes are 1D, 1D&2D, 1D&2D bright environnement and 1D&2D reflective surface

Parameters
modeInteger value that must be one of the constants defined within the eICBarCode_ImagerMode enumeration
- (void) enableAimerFlashing: (BOOL)  enabled

Enable or disable the flashing of the aimer.

Parameters
enabledBoolean argument that represents the desired state of the aimer flashing property
- (void) enableSymbologies: (int *)  symbologies
symbologyCount: (int)  count 

Enable a list of symbologies.

The array must contains NSInteger corresponding to the symbologies you wish to enable (eICBarCodeSymbologies) set symbologies to NULL or define symbologyCount to 0 to disable all symbologies.

Parameters
symbologiesAn integer array of scanner barcode types defined within the eICBarCodeSymbologies enumeration
countThe total number of barcode types contained within the symbologies array
- (void) enableSymbology: (int)  type
enabled: (BOOL)  enabled 

Enable or disable a specific symbology.

Parameters
typeThe symbology to be enabled/disabled. Refer to eICBarCodeSymbologies enumeration for all possible values
enabledThe new state to apply to the symbology
- (void) enableTransmitEAN8BarcodesAsEAN13: (BOOL)  enabled

Enable transmission of EAN 8 barcodes as EAN-13.

EAN-8 is the EAN equivalent of UPC-E in the sense that it provides a "short" barcode for small packages. An EAN-8 barcode is shorter than an EAN-13 barcode, although somewhat longer than an UPC-E barcode.
This function allows decoded EAN-8 barcodes to be converted and transmitted as EAN-13.

Parameters
enabledBoolean that should be set to YES to enable transmission of EAN-8 barcodes as EAN-13, NO to disable this conversion.
- (void) enableTransmitUPCABarcodesAsEAN13: (BOOL)  enabled

Enable transmission of UPC-A barcodes as EAN-13.

EAN 13 is an extended form of UPC-A and adds a country code. The Companion scanner can be configured using this method to convert and transmit UPC-A barcodes in the EAN-13 format. The enabled argument should be set to YES to enable the conversion, to NO to send UPC-A barcodes as they are. By default, the Companion scanner is configured to not transmit UPC-A barcodes as EAN-13.

Parameters
enabledBoolean that should be set to YES to enable transmission of UPC-A barcodes as EAN-13, NO to disable this conversion.
- (void) enableTransmitUPCEBarcodesAsUPCA: (BOOL)  enabled

Enable transmission of UPC-E barcodes as UPC-A.

UPC-E is a variation of UPC-A which allows for a more compact barcode by eliminating "extra" zeros. Since the resulting UPC-E barcode is about half the size of an UPC-A barcode, UPC-E is generally used on products with very small packaging where a full UPC-A barcode couldn't reasonably fit.
This function allows decoded UPC-E barcodes to be converted and transmitted as UPC-A.

Parameters
enabledBoolean that should be set to YES to enable transmission of UPC-E barcodes as UPC-A, NO to disable this conversion.
- (BOOL) enableTrigger: (BOOL)  enabled

Enable or disable the trigger button of the barcode reader.

Parameters
enabledIf set to YES, the trigger keys are enabled, otherwise, they are disabled.
Returns
A boolean indicating wether the command succeded or not. If equal to YES, then the trigger enable/disable request was executed properly.
- (int) getBarCodeReaderMode

Get the current barcode reader mode.

Please refer to configureBarCodeReaderMode

Returns
An integer of the eICBarCode_ScanMode constants (singlescanMode or MultiscanMode)
- (void) goodScanBeepEnable: (BOOL)  enabled

Enable / Disable beep.

Use this method if you wish to enable/disable the beep when a barcode is successfully read

Parameters
enabledA boolean value to enable/disable the good scan beep
- (int) illuminationLevel

Gets the current illumination level.

Returns
Integer between 0 and 100 representing the illumination level of the barcode reader's light
- (void) illuminationLevel: (int)  level

Defines the maximum brightness (percentage, from 0 to 100%)

Set the maximum brightness level of the illumination LEDs that can be used to achieve the lighting goal. The parameter value corresponds to a percentage from 0 to 100% (0% = off, 100% = brightest).

Note: Set the illumination level on a lower setting when reading shiny barcode labels where high intensity lighting will be too bright to decode the label.

Parameters
levelInteger value in the range [0, 100] of the illumination level to be set.
- (void) illuminationMode: (int)  mode

configures the barcode illumination mode, according the the enum eICBarCode_IlluminationMode

Parameters
modeAn interger value of the illumination mode to be set. All possible values are defined within the eICBarCode_IlluminationMode enumeration.
- (int) illuminiationMode

Get the current illumination mode of the barcode scanner.

Returns
An integer representing one of the illumination modes defined in eICBarCode_IlluminationMode
- (BOOL) isSymbologyEnabled: (int)  type

Determine whether the decoding of the specific symbology is enabled.

This method tells whether a symbology is enabled by the scanner. It is synchronous and may be time-consuming in case the scanner is busy doing other stuff. It should be better performed in a background thread.

Parameters
typeA symbology constant defined within eICBarCodeSymbologies enumeration
Returns
returns TRUE if the symbology is enabled
+ (BOOL) isSymbologySupported: (int)  type

Test whether the symbology is supported.

Parameters
typeThe symbology to be tested. One of the constants of eICBarCodeSymbologies
Returns
returns YES if the symbology is supported
- (BOOL) isTriggerEnabled

Retrieve the trigger state of the barcode scanner.

This is a synchronous and blocking method. It should be better run in background since it may be time-consuming

Returns
The trigger's enabled/disabled state
- (int) lightingGoal

Gets the current lighting goal of the barcode scanner.

Returns
Integer ranging from 0 to 255
- (void) lightingGoal: (int)  goal

Target average light intensity, from 0 to 255.

The lighting goal is the average light intensity that the scanner tries to achieve when capturing an image.
If the lighting goal is set too low, the image will be dark (underexposed).
If it is set too high the image will be too bright (overexposed).
Use the lighting mode setting to determine how the scanner tries to acheive the lighting goal.

Parameters
goalAn integer value in the range [0, 255]
- (int) lightingMode

Gets the lighting mode of the barcode scanner.

Returns
Integer representing one of the lighting modes defined in eICBarCode_LightingMode
- (void) lightingMode: (int)  priorityType

LightingGoal mode : illumination priority or aperture priority.

The lighting mode determines how the scanner tries to acheive the lighting goal. Priority can be given to the illumination LEDs or to aperture (exposure time). Using the illum LED priority setting results in shorter exposure time, therefore less risk of blurred images.
Use the aperture priority setting when you have a shiny barcode label where high intensity lighting will be too bright to decode it.

Parameters
priorityTypeMust be one of the values defined within eICBarCode_LightingMode enumeration.
- (void) playBeep: (int)  frequency
during: (int)  onTimeMs
andWait: (int)  offTimeMs 

play the frequency (from 1000 to 4095) for "onTimeMs" ms then wait "offTimeMs" ms

This is a non-blocking method. Call it sequencially in order to play a sequence of "beeps".

Parameters
frequencyThe beep sound frequency
onTimeMsThe duration in milliseconds of the beep
offTimeMsSilence in milliseconds (0 to 4095 ms) after the beep.
- (void) setBeep: (BOOL)  enabled
frequency: (int)  frequency
andLength: (int)  length 

Configure beep features.

This method changes the scan and error beep length and frequency

Parameters
enabledA boolean value to enable or disable the beep sound
frequency: from 1000 to 4095 kHz
length: in ms
+ (NSString*) symbologyToText: (int)  type

Converts symbology code to its text representation.

Parameters
typeA barcode type. All the symbologies are defined within eICBarCodeSymbologies
Returns
an NSString containing the name of the symbology
- (void) unbufferSetupCommands

Reenable the setupwrite message, and send ALL buffered setup command in one message.

A call to this selector whithout a previous call to bufferWriteCommands has no effect
